iso.longdescription:
Kubuntu is a widely used Linux distribution predominantly targeted at desktop users. It concentrates on usability, ease of installation, and working 'out of the box'.
The CD includes the operating system and the most common applications, such as: - Firefox - OpenOffice - Gaim (instant messaging) - Gimp (similar to photoshop) - Compilers, IDEs
A lot of other software can be downloaded automatically from the web (using Synaptic).
Kubuntu is sponsored by Canonical Ltd., a private company founded by South African entrepreneur Mark Shuttleworth.
